channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed - thesixthaxis_com
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for thesixthaxis_com

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 17/05/25
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/05/17/something-for-the-weekend-17-05-25/

Are you going to be ripping and tearing your way through the weekend? The release of DOOM: The Dark Ages is upon us, and it’s a great new take on id Software’s iconic shooter series. I fully intend to carry on my playthrough, though I do have plenty of games to be juggling and previews to write up this weekend!

In the News This Week

  • The Sinking City Remastered is available right now!
  • Marvel 1943: Rise of Hydra has been delayed to 2026
  • STALKER: Legends of the Zone is being enhanced further for PS5, Xbox Series X|S and PC next week
  • Ubisoft delays its “biggest productions” after AC Shadows delay led to a better game
  • Microsoft is laying off 3% of all employees affecting thousands of jobs
  • Bungie pins Marathon art plagiarism on former employee, promises to “do right” by original artist
  • Jade Raymond has now left Haven Studios, leaves questions over PlayStation live service Fairgames
  • Nintendo details 12 free Switch 2 game updates – resolution, frame rate, HDR & GameShare
  • Warhammer 40,000: Speed Freeks launches on May 22nd
  • 1047 debuts impressive Splitgate 2 map creator The Lab ahead of open beta
  • Riders Republic is getting a movie adaptation

Games in Review & Featured Articles

A quieter week in the features this time around, but let’s start with the reviews:

  • Capcom Fighting Collection 2 – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 9/10
  • Lunar Remastered Collection – PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 8/10

Alongside the games, Dom had reviews of the PowerA OPS V3 Pro Wireless Controller and the Game Boy recreation ModRetro Chromatic.

Away from that, Aran revisited Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine, with the ongoing popularity for its sequel, and What We Played featured Doom: The Dark Ages, Clair Obscur & Capcom Fighting Collection 2.

Trailer Park

Hogwarts Legacy Switch 2 gameplay comparison and discounted upgrade revealed

A Blades of Fire demo is out now with saves carrying over to the full game

Lost in Random: The Eternal Die release date revealed

Your Achievements

What have you been playing this week?

  • TSBonyman has continued with Oblivion Remastered, with his pirate crew giving him plenty of money to use to bribe people and make up for how rubbish he is at persuasion.

That’s the round up for this week. Hope you have a great weekend ahead and we’ll see you back here next week!
